item.title: Need help with 2 things (GUI)
item.dc:creator: @mod_taharok Taharok
item.description:
@mod_taharok wrote:

[quote=“Frell, post:9, topic:143441”]Use the filewriter. Ill try to get it for you.

In the action method of the jmenu put this:

BufferedWriter bufferedwriter = null;
        try
        {
            bufferedwriter = new BufferedWriter(new FileWriter((new StringBuilder()).append("").append(s).append(".txt").toString()));
        }
        catch(IOException ioexception)
        {
            ioexception.printStackTrace();
        }
        try
        {
            bufferedwriter.write(s1);
        }
        catch(IOException ioexception1)
        {
            ioexception1.printStackTrace();
        }
        try
        {
            bufferedwriter.flush();
        }
        catch(IOException ioexception2)
        {
            ioexception2.printStackTrace();
        }
    }

Well i just tore that out of my batch IDE so your going to have to edit it a bit.[/quote]

try {
	BufferedWriter writer = new BufferedWriter(new FileWriter(s + ".txt"));
	writer.write(s1);
	writer.close();
} catch (IOException ioe) {
	ioe.printStackTrace();
}

That saves a lot of space and is a lot easier to read.

[quote=“tedyslilnoob, post:5, topic:143441”]okill give it a try thanks

this is really nooby sorry!

C:\Documents and Settings\Owner\Desktop\Java\Test.java:124: illegal start of expression final String url = "http://www.google.com"; ^ 1 error[/quote]

Is it inside of a method?

Read full topic
